meanings.definition: To build or construct something vertically
meanings.sent1: They erected a tent in the backyard for the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The workers erected a new building in the city center.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels erected a tiny acorn statue in the park.
meanings.sent4: His determination erected a wall of success in front of him.
meanings.sent5: The towering skyscraper was erected in record time.

meanings.definition: To set up or establish something
meanings.sent1: The team erected a booth at the fair to promote their product.
meanings.sent2: The government erected new laws to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: She erected a rule that no one could eat dessert before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The idea of equality erected a strong foundation for the community.
meanings.sent5: The company erected a successful business model over the years.

meanings.definition: To cause something to stand upright
meanings.sent1: The strong wind erected the fallen sign back into position.
meanings.sent2: The teacher erected the whiteboard for the class presentation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat erected the vase on the edge of the table.
meanings.sent4: His words erected a sense of pride in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays erected the flowers towards the sky.
